channel.title: NPR Programs: Morning Edition
channel.description: Morning Edition takes listeners around the country and the world with multi-faceted stories and commentaries every weekday. Hosts Steve Inskeep, Leila Fadel, Michel Martin and A Martínez bring you the latest breaking news and features to prepare you for the day.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: HHS sending more agents to Minnesota as protests over Renee Good's death continue
item.description: The killing of Renee Good by an ICE agent sparked protests across Minneapolis. Federal authorities have taken over the investigation and say they're sending more Homeland Security agents to Minnesota.
item.content:encoded: The killing of Renee Good by an ICE agent sparked protests across Minneapolis. Federal authorities have taken over the investigation and say they're sending more Homeland Security agents to Minnesota.
item.dc:creator: Jason DeRose

item.title: Minneapolis mayor talks about the killing of Renee Good and the protests against ICE
item.description: NPR's Leila Fadel speaks with Minneapolis Mayor Jacob Frey about residents protesting the Trump administration's ICE deployment and the killing of Renee Good by an immigration officer.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Leila Fadel speaks with Minneapolis Mayor Jacob Frey about residents protesting the Trump administration's ICE deployment and the killing of Renee Good by an immigration officer.
item.dc:creator: Leila Fadel

item.title: Trump wants to add the West Wing to his list of construction projects
item.description: President Trump is on a remodeling and construction spree. In addition to the White House ballroom project, Trump wants to add a second story to the West Wing colonnade.
item.content:encoded: President Trump is on a remodeling and construction spree. In addition to the White House ballroom project, Trump wants to add a second story to the West Wing colonnade.
item.dc:creator: Tamara Keith

item.title: Exercise is as effective as medication in treating depression, study finds
item.description: New research shows exercise is as effective as medication at reducing symptoms of depression. And you don't need to run a marathon to see benefits. So how much is enough?
item.content:encoded:
New research shows exercise is as effective as medication at reducing symptoms of depression. And you don't need to run a marathon to see benefits. So how much is enough?

(Image credit: Maskot)
item.dc:creator: Allison Aubrey

item.title: Law giving pregnant women in Florida access to disabled parking faces legal challenge
item.description: A new law that allows pregnant women in Florida to access disabled parking spots is getting pushback and is headed to court.
item.content:encoded: A new law that allows pregnant women in Florida to access disabled parking spots is getting pushback and is headed to court.
item.dc:creator: Kerry Sheridan

item.title: Morning news brief
item.description: HHS sending more agents to Minnesota as protests over Renee Good's death continue, Iran warns U.S. against military actions after protest crackdown, DOJ subpoenas Fed in escalating pressure campaign.
item.content:encoded: HHS sending more agents to Minnesota as protests over Renee Good's death continue, Iran warns U.S. against military actions after protest crackdown, DOJ subpoenas Fed in escalating pressure campaign.
item.dc:creator: A Martínez

item.title: Why the Trump administration wants to 'take over' Greenland
item.description: President Trump has restated his intent to "take over" Greenland. NPR's A Martinez speaks to Rebecca Pincus of the Foreign Policy Research Institute about why Greenland is so important.
item.content:encoded: President Trump has restated his intent to "take over" Greenland. NPR's A Martinez speaks to Rebecca Pincus of the Foreign Policy Research Institute about why Greenland is so important.
item.dc:creator: A Martínez

item.title: Venezuela releases political prisoners days after U.S. removes Nicolas Maduro
item.description: Venezuela has begun releasing political prisoners in what the government calls a goodwill gesture, days after the U.S. seized President Nicolás Maduro.
item.content:encoded: Venezuela has begun releasing political prisoners in what the government calls a goodwill gesture, days after the U.S. seized President Nicolás Maduro.
item.dc:creator: John Otis

item.title: U.S. figure skating team selected for Winter Olympics after week of competition
item.description: The week of competition at the U.S. Figure Skating National Championships wrapped up Sunday, and the skaters that will represent Team USA in the Milan-Cortina Olympics in February have been named.
item.content:encoded: The week of competition at the U.S. Figure Skating National Championships wrapped up Sunday, and the skaters that will represent Team USA in the Milan-Cortina Olympics in February have been named.
item.dc:creator: Rachel Treisman

item.title: How to responsibly recycle your children's old toys
item.description: Now that the holiday gift-giving season is over, parents may be looking for ways to recycle or donate their children's old toys. Here's what you need to know about recycling responsibly.
item.content:encoded: Now that the holiday gift-giving season is over, parents may be looking for ways to recycle or donate their children's old toys. Here's what you need to know about recycling responsibly.
item.dc:creator: Hosts
